page.title: 20Flooding at Hampton Bishop.
page.content: There have been several floods in the area around Hampton Bishop.The village was built on low land close to the confluence of the{River Wye}and the {River Lugg. A bank was built to help prevent the water reaching the village.This was called,{'The Stank'. In 1960 the area was flooded in January and December.In January parts of the village were covered in water up to{seven feet}deep.People were rescued from their homes by the R.A.F.,the W.R.V.S. and the Police. The flood in December was even worse.The Stank began to crack and break. The army used boats and a helicopter to take people to Hereford until the water subsided.Farmers were unable to use their fields for three weeks .
